1998 FIFA World Cup squads

\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t
From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t\tJump to:\t\t\t\t\tnavigation, \t\t\t\t\tsearch\n\t\t\t\t
\n\t\t\t\t

The 1998 FIFA World Cup was the 16th FIFA World Cup, a quadrennial football tournament contested by the senior men\'s teams of the national associations affiliated to FIFA (the International Federation of Association Football). The tournament was played in France from 10 June to 12 July 1998 and featured 32 teams divided into eight groups of four. Each team was required to submit a squad of 22 players \xe2\x80\x93 numbered sequentially from 1 to 22 \xe2\x80\x93 from whom they would select their teams for each match at the tournament, with the final squads to be submitted by 1 June 1998. In total, 704 players were selected for the tournament.

\n

Players\' ages as of 10 June 1998 \xe2\x80\x93 the tournament\'s opening day.

Player representation by league[edit]

\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n
CountryPlayersPercentOutside national squad
Total736
England10714.53%85
Italy709.51%50
Spain709.51%48
Germany537.2%35
Japan304.07%8
France293.94%20
Mexico263.53%5
Netherlands233.13%13
Saudi Arabia222.99%0
USA212.85%5
Argentina202.71%14
Others26536%
\n

The English, Spanish, Japanese and Saudi Arabian squads were made up entirely of players from the respective countries\' domestic leagues. The Nigeria squad was made up entirely of players employed by foreign clubs. Only three teams, Japan, Mexico, and Saudi Arabia, had no players from European clubs.

\n

Although Turkey and Portugal failed to qualify for the finals, their domestic leagues were represented by 18 and 9 players respectively: altogether, there were 38 national leagues who had players in the tournament.

\n
